alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 10:49PM CDT until March 25 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Sucarnoochee River At Livingston affecting Sumter County. .Flooding continues on the Sucarnoochee River near Livingston and a flood warning remains in effect. Another statement will be issued by Wednesday afternoon, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sucarnoochee River At Livingston. * WHEN...Until Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Overflow of low-lying agricultural lands increases. Cattle and farm equipment should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 18.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM CDT Tuesday was 18.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.5 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
